title: Can the Samsung Company buy Apple? - Quora

response.answer_text: Samsung Electronics alone can’t but Apple Inc. But Samsung Group can buy Apple. Samsung is not only in the electronic industry. It is also in many other fields. Burj Khalifa, Taipei 101 and Petronas Towers were constructed by the Samsung C&T division of the Samsung Group. Where as the total assets of Apple Inc is US$375.319 billion and total equity is US$134.047 billion in 2017. Given these figures, Samsung Group can comfortably buy Apple Inc.

Samsung would not be able to buy Apple for multiple reasons. Apple’s market cap is over $1 trillion as of August 2018. All of Samsung’s subsidiaries combined are worth less than that. Samsung could likely get funding from the Korean government and investment banks if they were seriously interested but there’s little evidence they are.Apple’s shareholders, which include Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway, would likely not agree to such an acquisitionApple and Samsung combined would have too much control of the smartphone market in the United States and many other developed countries. Such an acquisition would not get regulatory approval.

I don’t think so. It’s the market cap that matters, and Samsung can’t buy Apple at its market cap. And we must take a look at Samsung’s cash reserve, not the total assets which includes fixed assets. We are not talking about exchanging Samsung for Apple, but Samsung buying Apple. Samsung Electronics announced on Feb. 17 that its cash reserves have surpassed 100 trillion won (US$88.80 billion). The Korean tech giant held cash reserves of 104 trillion won as of the end-2018, up 24.7 percent on-year. Apple’s market cap as of Jul 19, 2019 is $932 billion. More than 10 times of Samsung’s cash reserve. Worse yet, anyone with the intention of acquiring a well-performing company must be prepared to pay a premium, way above its market price. If Apple’s market price is $932 billion, the premium will be way above that.

No, for a number of reasons.   1.) Anti-trust oversight, the Neither the U.S. Or EU regulators would approve of this transaction because it would lessen competition in the smartphone, tablet, tv and wearable tech markets.   2.)  Google would not approve of this deal.   Google supplies Samsung with free Android software and Google App Store for their phones/ tablets.   A Samsung and Apple merger would chill the Samsung - Google relationship.   Without Android Samsung cannot compete because they do not have their own operating software.   3.) Samsung has a market value of about $166 Billion and Apple has a market value of about $752 Billion.  If not for reasons #1 and #2 Apple could buy Samsung if they wanted to.   But they wouldn't want to.

So Samsung cannot afford to buy Apple. No financial arrangement can allow him to make such an attempt. Moreover, Samsung's interest in buying Apple is non-existent in my opinion. On the other hand, Apple has no interest in buying Samsung. This would be made impossible by the laws of South Korea in my opinion as well. So Apple and Samsung will continue to compete in the world of smartphones and tablets.
